item.title: Ticket #1506 (upgrade.php "have fun" link to blog is blank) created
item.dc:creator: ryanduff
item.description:
upgrade php uses get_settings('home') instead of get_settings('url') to generate the link back to the main page. Home is currently an empty variable.

Patch attached.

item.title: Ticket #1505 (user_level field doesn't exist on fresh install [patch]) created
item.dc:creator: ringmaster
item.description:
On a fresh install, the install.php attempts to set the user level for the first (admin) user, and cannot because that field no longer exists.

The installer should use the new role system.

Patch attached.

item.title: Ticket #1504 (install error, database error [Unknown column 'user_level' in 'field list']) created
item.dc:creator: derek73
item.description:
After running install.php script, using the web-based interface to create the wp-config.php file, I get the following error.

WordPress database error: [Unknown column 'user_level' in 'field list'] 

INSERT INTO wp_users (ID, user_login, user_pass, user_email, user_level, user_registered) VALUES ( '1', 'admin', MD5('11fe7b'), 'derek@mail.com', '10', NOW() )

sendmail is not working properly on this server, in case that matters. The admin user is not added to the database, and I am not able to log in (contrary to the message on wp-admin/install.php?step=2 "Finished''' Now you can log in ").

Some of my config info:

mysql Ver 12.22 Distrib 4.0.24, for pc-linux-gnu (i386)

PHP 4.3.11 (cli) (built: Jul 3 2005 21:11:10) (DEBUG)

lighttpd-1.3.10 (ssl)

svn info:

URL: â€‹http://svn.automattic.com/wordpress/trunk

Revision: 2703

Last Changed Date: 2005-07-11 15:39:50 -0700 (Mon, 11 Jul 2005)

item.title: Ticket #1503 (Warning: join(): Bad arguments in wp-includes/functions.php on line 1230) updated
item.dc:creator: seth
item.description: Version, Milestone changed

item.title: Ticket #1503 (Warning: join(): Bad arguments in wp-includes/functions.php on line 1230) created
item.dc:creator: seth
item.description:
As of changeset 2702, blogs are no longer functional, returning this error.

The mentioned portion is: 

function update_user_cache() {
        global $cache_userdata, $wpdb;
        $level_key = $wpdb->prefix . 'user_level';
        $user_ids = $wpdb->get_col("SELECT user_id FROM $wpdb->usermeta WHERE meta_key = '$level_key'");
        $user_ids = join(',', $user_ids);
        $query = apply_filters('user_cache_query', "SELECT * FROM $wpdb->users WHERE ID IN ($user_ids)");

item.title: Ticket #893 (Under Apache 2 dashboard blank) updated
item.dc:creator: R_i_c_h_a_r_d
item.description:
Also just noticed error() method being referenced on lines 377 and 389 of rss-functions.php, again not attached to an object. The line:

$cache = new RSSCache( MAGPIE_CACHE_DIR, MAGPIE_CACHE_AGE );

appears after and within a seperate if statement, so $cache can not be used here at present.

item.title: Ticket #893 (Under Apache 2 dashboard blank) updated
item.dc:creator: R_i_c_h_a_r_d
item.description:
Got the same problem. I tracked mine down to line 492 of wp-includes/rss-functions.php

The line is: error( $errormsg );

I think it should be: $cache->error( $errormsg );

item.title: Ticket #1502 (Themes and Plugins pages don't check to see if file is readable) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: Keywords, Milestone changed

item.title: Ticket #1502 (Themes and Plugins pages don't check to see if file is readable) created
item.dc:creator: masquerade
item.description:
Neither the themes or plugin information grabbing code use is_readable() before trying to open a file. This occurs in multiple places in admin-functions.php and can cause errors for files that are not readable by the webserver. I'll submit a patch tomorrow, unless someone beats me to it.

Note: This is not a dupe of #1370 , it points out problems beyond what's listed there.
